creator: marcello.atzeni@fst.it
text:
At present, every listener saves the test results in the same way, no matter 
how they collect and show the results: i.e. they save the time and 
success/failure result of each test.

It would be more intuitive if each listener had its own file structure, based 
on its behaviour and data collected.

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
This is not a good idea.  You are free to view any results file with any viewer,
and that is a good thing.  For those who want to deal with the results file
themselves, it's nice that there's a single format to learn, rather than many. 
And furthermore, it's nice that developers who want to write their own listener
don't have to worry about saving results at all - it's comletely taken care of
for them.
